SEURAT.search
Class Utilities

java.lang.Object
  SEURAT.search.Utilities

public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object

Utility Functions Which Really Aren't Even Related to Search Functionality. However most of these methods haven't been implemented in some standard location yet. TODO: Move this class somewhere more appropriate

Author:
hannasm

Field Detail

g_rationaleElementIcons

private static java.util.Map<org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor,org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image> g_rationaleElementIcons
Container mapping ImageDescriptors to actual icons, this is used to prevent duplicating heavy-duty image classes and reduced load times.

g_RationaleErrorLevelIcons

private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image> g_RationaleErrorLevelIcons
Constructor Detail

Utilities

public Utilities()
Method Detail

getExplorer

public static RationaleExplorer getExplorer(RationaleElement pElement)
Find the RationaleExplorer in the workspace. This will perform a search throughout all open workbenches and is probably a horrible way of finding the rationale explorer.

Parameters:
pElement - any rationale element which should be in the rationale explorer.
Returns:
a reference to the best RationaleExplorer or null if none was found.

getTreeParentFromElement

public static TreeParent getTreeParentFromElement(RationaleExplorer pExplorer,
                                                  RationaleElement pElement)
Parameters:
pExplorer - the rationale explorer that has the treeparent we want
pElement - the rationale element whose treeparent we want to find
Returns:
a pointer to the first treeparent that is associated with the rationale element or null if no tree parent could be found.

openEditorForRationale

public static void openEditorForRationale(RationaleElement pElement)
This function will automatically deduce the appropriate editor to use when opening a rationale element.

Parameters:
pElement - the rationale element to open in an editor

getEditorFromRationale

public static java.lang.Class getEditorFromRationale(RationaleElement pElement)
Parameters:
pElement - the rationale element which wants an editor
Returns:
the integrated editor class which is most capable of editing the specified rationale

getRationaleElementIcon

public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image getRationaleElementIcon(RationaleElementType pType,
                                                                     RationaleErrorLevel pError,
                                                                     boolean pActive,
                                                                     java.lang.String pName,
                                                                     RationaleElement pElement)

getRationaleElementIcon

public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image getRationaleElementIcon(RationaleElement pElement)
Find the best icon to display for a given rationale element, if the image has not already been loaded it is placed into a cache so that subsequent uses of the image does not require additional loads, and also reduces memory overhead

Parameters:
pElement - the rationale element whose icon should be retrieved
Returns:
an Image or null if no image could be found

getErrorLevelIcon

public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image getErrorLevelIcon(java.lang.String pErrorLevel)

getErrorLevelIcon

public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image getErrorLevelIcon(RationaleErrorLevel pErrorLevel)
